website_summaries.verdict: Works as advertised with good quality results at a nice price point. Limited to 2 outputs.
pros: Excellent video quality to both output devices
Able to bypass HDCP when needed for certain use cases
Nice price if you only need 2 outputs
cons: Not compatible with some newer standards, like 4K

customer_reviews.title: Jan 2018, DOES NOT Strip HDCP!
customer_reviews.text: Just as others have posted, as of Jan 2018, the Model VHD-1x2MN3D Does NOT strip HDCP. I needed this to connect an older system and it would not validate the signal.
customer_reviews.author: Mr W

customer_reviews.title: Works with my PS3 (HDCP Bypass) - 11/2019
customer_reviews.text: As of November 2019 purchased from J&R Galaxies, this item can indeed strip/bypass the HDCP from a PS3 console. Some reviews said it can, some it can't, but it definitely did. I had tried a handful (roughly 4) different products to strip the HDCP so I could stream PS3 games and none worked. I am completely happy that this one did the trick. I'm not even using it as an actual splitter. I only use one output so it's essentially an inline filter to remove HDCP. No noticeable impact on picture quality or lag. Does the job I wanted it to.
customer_reviews.author: Broken

customer_reviews.title: Did not resolve Roku HDCP issue
customer_reviews.text: Bought it on Recommendation from How To Geek article titled "Why HDCP Causes Errors on Your HDTV and How to Fix Them". Others in these reviews have had success with it. Not me. The article does say that the quality can vary from device to device...of them same model. I got a bad one.
customer_reviews.author: tbehling

customer_reviews.title: Fixed HDCP Issue!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Finally!!! I found something that actually fixes the ridiculous Spectrum HDCP issue. For some reason, Spectrum fails to realize that home theaters route audio AND video through a receiver. Their cable box installation guide shows the HDMI routed to the TV directly, with the digital audio going from the cable box to the receiver separately. Yes, this will work, but complicates source switching unnecessarily with home theater set-ups. Installation was a breeze, literally plug and play. Re-boot the receiver and life is good again!!!
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work past the first night...
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a nice (not cheap) splitter. Hooked it up, worked great the first night. But not the second night or thereafter - right back to original problem. It didn't bypass the HDCP error, shuts down the tv.
customer_reviews.author: KLMadison

customer_reviews.title: Solved HDCP Error woth Roku
customer_reviews.text: Hooking a new Roku Ultra to my older Sony TV through a 4 device HDMI switch. I was immediately frustrated by Roku reporting HDCP error when I tried to stream video. I tried shorter HDMI cables with no luck. I had temporary success by moving the Roku to a different input of the switch, but streaming was choppy and the HDCP Error would usually reoccur. If I hooked Roku directly to the TV it was fine, but my older TV has only two HDMI inputs, so it was not a permanent option for me. BOTTOM LINE: I installed this box between the Roku and the switch and no more streaming choppiness and no more HDCP error.
customer_reviews.author: Boxter

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work as well as older one
customer_reviews.text: Purchased another of these splitters to use for my computer setups. The old one works with any two monitors I connect to it. This newer one only works with some monitors. It can't even send a valid video signal to some monitors, causing them to display corrupted video. I tried switching cables and powering it on as recommended in the instructions. Did not fix the issues. It does work with some monitors, but not all of them, hence the low rating. Since I don't like finicky technology, I won't be buying another one of theses. I would not recommend this item to anyone using it with computer monitors.
customer_reviews.author: patbob

customer_reviews.title: Solves the Roku HDCP problem
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in an effort to solve the sudden HDCP error with my older Panasonic TV and my Roku device. I had bought a refurbished Roku hoping the older model would work, but it didn't. I had bought an Android TV device and the interface is terrible. I finally found this solution, which worked immediately, without any switching out of cables. I read that some have not had success with this method of stripping HDCP, but it's worth the $19 to try it.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Bess

customer_reviews.title: Enables PS3/PS4 HDMI Capture *As of NOV 08, 2019*
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a recording solution to capture PS3 HDMI signals with your Elgato Capture card (Or any capture card for that matter) this is the easy choice. As of writing this November 08, 2019 this enables you to record a PS3 HDMI signal with no quality loss of any kind. Purchased it solely for that purpose and it works right out of the box with no special setup needed (like having anything plugged in ahead of time). It works exactly as I need it to and HIGHLY recommend it to anyone looking for a similar solution.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: The splitter works beautifully. The manual advises to turn off when not being used. A problem with that is, if you wish to record from your cable later on, you must be there to turn it on again, so you must leave it on all day (or night). The problem is that it gets very hot thereby causing failure of the splitter. Here is the easy solution: remove the circuit board from the enclosure, keeping it away from anything metal (short-circuit). To protect from touching metal and keep out dust, drape a cheesecloth over it. That's it! It becomes cool enough to cause no failure. I leave mine on almost 24/7 without any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Jack the paintball man

customer_reviews.title: No more HDCP error message & silent tv
customer_reviews.text: Out of the blue, started having "Your tv cannot support HDCP video over your high definition connection" error msg. Also, was having intermittent no sound from tv. Installed this gizmo a month ago, bingo!, instantly, no more error msg, and no more lack of sound. Thanx to howtogeek.com and all who pointed to the article and product. My Vizio D32F-F1 32" tv is watchable and audible!
customer_reviews.author: Joe Y.

customer_reviews.title: Works but Port 1 dead after 1 year
customer_reviews.text: The device works good and for about a year it has worked well. About two weeks ago I started having problem with no signal. After going through various steps to isolate the issue it was determined that HDMI output port 1 is defective. Thankfully the device has 2 HDMI output ports and I am able to use the 2nd output port. Hopefully the 2nd port last another year. The device seems to get pretty hot too. It is very warm to the touch which likely has something to do with the port burning out. The device is less than $20 so this isn't earth shattering but don't expect it to last.
customer_reviews.author: The Y Family

customer_reviews.title: HDCP Bypass still working! July 2020
customer_reviews.text: I needed HDCP Bypass and this device still allows that feature. Devices such as this tend to be hit or miss though, so be prepared if it doesn't work. I will say however if it doesn't work on your first try, don't give up just yet. I had to try several different combinations of HDMI cables. I don't think my HDMI cables are the newer HDMI standard so perhaps using the newer HDMI cables would make things work right off the bat. If not, swap the cables around, and try different ones and hopefully it'll work for you.
customer_reviews.author: Stu

customer_reviews.title: Removes HDCP!
customer_reviews.text: I have a Slingplayer connected to my cable box but couldn't use it because I kept getting HDCP errors. I heard that this strips out the HDCP signal and I can confirm that it does and now I'm able to access my Slingplayer from my phone from anywhere. Now I hope it just lasts longer than another HDMI splitter that I bought before.
customer_reviews.author: Kealii

customer_reviews.title: No video signal, just 'HDCP error detected'
customer_reviews.text: Trying to use this with a Roku plus fully HDCP compliant equipment. "HDCP error detected" Re-checked all equipment. "HDCP error detected." Swapped out fully compliant cable with the fully compliant cable from another manufacturer. "HDCP error detected." Tried with different surge protector and re-set all equipment. Still don't get any video. Just - "HDCP error detected." This mini splitter is useless.
customer_reviews.author: Anaeee

customer_reviews.title: ViewHD 2 Port 1x2 Powered HDMI Mini Splitter for 1080P & 3D | Model: VHD-1X2MN3D
customer_reviews.text: Works really well until it doesn't. I have had this for 2.5 months. It worked really well so I could record my DVD movies from my DVD player. I wanted to save them to digital. It bypassed the hdcp so I could do that. But it quit working altogether (no more video coming through). I have contacted the company that makes it so we will see if their warranty is true. I left it plugged in all the time so figured I shouldn't have done that. Only plug it in when wanting to use it, maybe.
customer_reviews.author: Barb

customer_reviews.title: HDCP Stripping -- Clarification
customer_reviews.text: This unit will strip HDCP up to version 1.4, but not 2.0 or higher (or at least, the ones I bought will). There is the possibility that older players and displays with newer firmware installed may have key revocation lists that will stop this from working. The bottom line is that if all the devices in your system are 1.4 and earlier, there is a good chance that this will work. If it does, DO NOT update the firmware in any of them, because doing so may break the HDCP stripping capability of this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. L

customer_reviews.title: Removed HDPC for those interested
customer_reviews.text: Connected downstream of my Roku box in order to record an NFL game from SLING TV. Used in conjunction with an Avermedia Live Gamer Portable 2 Plus in stand alone mode. Without this splitter, the Avermedia would not record the stream. Now it does. The quality of the steam is decent but not perfect, but this is probably the fault of Avermedia. I never expected it to be as good as the broadcast stream. Now I'm able to record any stream from my Roku device. All the recordings I make are for my own personal use.
customer_reviews.author: GSFITZ

customer_reviews.title: Fixed my "No Signal" issue from my Spectrum/Tivo Bolt/Denon/Samsung TV
customer_reviews.text: My set up hasn't changed but for some reason (I suspect a Spectrum update) I started having issues getting a picture from my Tivo on my Denon. I'd read about HDMI handshake issues, DCHP stripping, and after countless google/youtube searches and following multiple setup changes to my hdmi set up, plugging this in solved whatever demon had started plaguing my system. Does it strip HDCP? I don't know, but I do know my Tivo Bolt can send sound and video to my Denon AVR x3500 and now plays it on my older 1K Samsung. Whew!
customer_reviews.author: MM in Los Angeles

customer_reviews.title: These work great!
customer_reviews.text: My company has purchased these for many years. We use them in applications that run 12 hours a day and they work very well. However if you plan on using them for extended periods of time take the cover off and install some small heat sinks of the chips inside and drill a few vent holes on the top and bottom. This extends the life considerably as they do get warm and don't have vents.
customer_reviews.author: jeremy sigel

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 1 year
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this HDMI splitter around Oct 1, 2018 and it worked well for almost exactly one year. Last week one of the two outputs stopped working and that side’s light turned off as well. Tried different cables and power cycling it to no avail. Worked well while it worked but stopped just outside of the 1yr warranty period. Also I can’t find a website or contact email for ViewHD to ask about a replacement so here I am leaving a review. Suggest buying from a better-known company with a website and dedicated support team.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Problem Solved
customer_reviews.text: For some reason, my Apple TV stopped communicating with my Samsung television. I tried switching the HDMI cord, to no avail. I thought about replacing my Apple TV but then researched the error code online and found that, although no one seems to understand why the devices get mad with each other and stop communicating, the fix would be this little relatively inexpensive little device. It came quickly and my son happened to be visiting when it arrived. He hooked it up to the television and hooked my Apple TV up to the device. And all is well again.
customer_reviews.author: T. Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: Ahh :-)
customer_reviews.text: Problem: unable to watch Amazon videos on older Nvidia Shield TV (2017). Amazon switched to encrypting all their video. I'd just end up getting a message that say's "check the HDMI cable" or some such. Amazon say's buy our hardware. Nvidia say buy a newer box with updated certificates/drivers. This little box does the trick. I can happily watch the re-runs of Baywatch again ;-)
customer_reviews.author: mjensen

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't remove HDCP as stated
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to get around an HDCP issue arising from some combination of my gaming PC's gpu and my capture card in my streaming PC. For reference, I have an AMD RX 480 8GB running the latest Crimson drivers and my capture card is an AVerMedia C985. I've read in multiple forums that using this specific HDMI splitter would get around this issue and end my headache once and for all, but I had no luck with it. I'm posting this review in hopes that someone can come up with a solution involving this splitter, but if not, I'm returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Works great for splitting Apple TV signal. Doesn't work for Directv. Model VHD-1X2MN3D
customer_reviews.text: It was hard for me to navigate all the reviews for what exactly this will and won't work for. I wanted to split both my directv and my apple tv outputs to go to my office in addition to the living room but just bought one to see what would actually work before I bought two of them. Turns out 1 is all I can use, as it works for Apple TV but not Directv. If anyone knows of one that works for Directv I'm all ears. But for Apple TV this works great.
customer_reviews.author: Reedly Bottomtooth

customer_reviews.title: Gets rid of annoying HDCP
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned when I saw people mention it doesn't get rid of HDCP, but it seems to work just fine. Bought this to use with a PS3 and Elgato which, previously, required me to use a frustrating work-around. Bought this after lots of recommendations and it works great and takes up very little space w/ very little setup work. Its unfortunate that it takes up another outlet space, but I suppose there's not anything to be done about that.
customer_reviews.author: Judgement0s

customer_reviews.title: HDMI has intrnal security . Check HDMC on internet.
customer_reviews.text: Worked just fine. It was purchased so my computer could duplicate my screen, otherwise TV couldn't find my computer although directly linked bt a HDMI cable. My computer screen would blank every 15 seconds and then come back and my pointer would jump around. All due to an HDMI security issue in the cable. Fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Reese

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: This device works perfectly! My DVR cable box only has one HDMI output, and both my TV and DVD player/recorder only have one HDMI input (no outputs). I use this device to send the signal from my DVR to my TV and to the DVD player/recorder. By using this device, I can see the status of the video signal that I want to record, and I know that the DVD player/recorder is getting the same video signal. Great idea!
customer_reviews.author: H. Font

customer_reviews.title: Removed HDCP
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I could connect my Xfinity X1 box to my Hauppauge HD PVR2 device to display TV on my computer. I wanted to use HDMI cables for the best quality image. It removed HDCP when I used output 2. Follow the instructions if you get no image. First I tried output 1 and got the HDCP message. When I switched to output 2 it worked.
customer_reviews.author: Michael McK.

customer_reviews.title: This is the device you need if your Samsung TV won't play nice with Tivo
customer_reviews.text: We bought the latest generation Tivo unit along with a new Samsung TV and were surprised to discover that many channels would not display because of a but in the way HDMI translates the digital copyright protection signals. This device instantly solves the problem. Plug the Tivo HDMI in one end and your TV into the other and Presto. Perfect pictures. Works exactly as advertised. I've learned that Tivo may even refund your purchase price if you press them. Glad to find it readily available and on Amazon Prime.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Westerman

customer_reviews.title: When the device (a Firestick) was connected directly to the TV (through an HDMI-DVI) adapter it worked fine. Not sure if this device changed the video ...
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping this would solve HDCP issues between my pioneer vsx-xxx receiver and my old Samsung DLP. The HDCP error went away but it was replaced by a "Not supported mode" error on the TV. When the device (a Firestick) was connected directly to the TV (through an HDMI-DVI) adapter it worked fine. Not sure if this device changed the video mode (I don't think it does any scaling) or caused the Firestick to change modes. Either way it didn't work and had to go back.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Smith

customer_reviews.title: What HDCP 2.2 ?
customer_reviews.text: I bought this exclusively to circumvent the HDCP 2.2 protocol which came on a new cable box. Although both my receiver and TV are supposedly compliant, it wouldn’t work, even with new HDMI cables. Just plug this little baby in and voila! It works. Irritated it was needed, but a simple fix.
customer_reviews.author: robert v

customer_reviews.title: Blocks HDCP .... it really does!
customer_reviews.text: Guess what folks. I just got this yesterday ands it DOES BLOCK HDCP. I am using it with a BlackMagic Ultrastudio mini recorder and haven’t been able to digitize from the HDMI port from my BluRay DVD. I am doing this using 30 year old DVD-Rs of old family videos. I connect the DVD players hdmi to the input of the splitter and then port 2 of the splitter goes to the BlackMagic mini recorder. DONT hook up anything to the splitters HDMI 1 port. Leave it empty or the HDCP signal comes back. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: Drew M.

customer_reviews.title: Solves HDCP "unauthorized" error message and other handshake problems legally
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased three of these devices to solve the HDCP problem with Roku Ultra and two Streaming Stick+ units. Two on new Vizio TV's and the other on an old Panasonic. Just received another to use on a HDCP problem causing a cable box and TV from having start up problems I have isolated to being caused by a crappy handshake. Flashing screen until restarted...sometimes. Two of these ordered in the last 6 months. I am a believer that this works. At lease 3 times so far.
customer_reviews.author: sagetek

customer_reviews.title: Excellent solution for HDCP problems with Amazon Prime and Roku
customer_reviews.text: Recently I've had problems getting myto play video from Amazon Prime. I would get an HDCP error as soon as the video started, and I'd have to unplug the HDMI cable briefly from the back of the Roku. I found from searching Google that others had this problem and that Roku support was useless, but someone suggested using this device, and it works beautifully now.
customer_reviews.author: LeeTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Works for streaming PS3 games on ElGato HD60!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in an effort to defeat the PS3's HDCP protection and allow me to stream games with my ElGato HD60s. I'm not sure what the other reviewers are talking about, but mine works fine; I have one HDMI cable going to my TV and the other going to my ElGato. I used it to stream for about 4 hours yesterday without issue. Like the other 1x2 HDMI splitters I've tried this one tends to get pretty warm while in operation, but it didn't get quite as hot as other models I tried. If it had some kind of cooling system I'd rate it 5/5.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Get rid of HDCP
customer_reviews.text: If you want to capture game play on your PSTV, PS3 / 4 Xbox or any console that has HDCP, then this is what you need. I have an internal capture card StarTech PEXHDCAP2. Before I was unable to get my PSTV to work, all I would get is that "HDCP" (first screen shot). Now I can play and record my games from my PC.
customer_reviews.author: BLKBRDSR71

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working Within a Year
customer_reviews.text: This is the second ViewHD splitter I've purchased only to have it fail within a year of use. Initially I purchased this splitter from ViewHD:  only to have one of the HDMI out ports stop working. It's the same case with this unit. Within a year the splitter stopped working and would no longer power on even after swapping the power cord. While it seems ViewHD's splitters do work for splitting a signal two ways and for stripping HDCP copy protection, (if that's what you're primarily looking for) they don't work as long term solutions. From my experience with these splitters, they will fail within a few months.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Pruitt

customer_reviews.title: Will Strip Apple HDCP from Macbooks feeding Microsoft Surface Hubs
customer_reviews.text: This device has many uses. However, we used it in the Corporate setting in conference rooms where we have Microsoft Surface Hubs for laptop projection. The newer Macbooks wont project via a straight HDMI cable. The Apple copyright protection software , the CP in HDCP, blocks the laptop image to go to the Surface Hub. This device strips the HDCP off the signal and projects perfectly. For under $25, this little device is tops!
customer_reviews.author: Bayareaboy

customer_reviews.title: Seems to remove HDCP just fine for me.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a splitter to remove HDCP so I could record gameplay videos. My old one was very finicky but this one seems to be pretty stable. For instance, switching between signals works and plugging in another HDMI cable to the second output doesn't cut the signal, lol. All in all, it works for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Lux

customer_reviews.title: Solves HDMI handshake issues!
customer_reviews.text: Solves HDMI handshake issues between my Verizon Quantum DVR and Pioneer receiver. Plugged the DVR into port 2 and then plugged the other end into my receiver and I now have video. After changing HDMI cables and trying at least 20 different ways to get video to pass through my receiver this inexpensive part did the trick.
customer_reviews.author: BH

customer_reviews.title: No complaints!
customer_reviews.text: I got this to use with a computer, splitting the DVI-to-HDMI signal to the TV in the living room and the TV in the bedroom, so I could use the computer on either TV. It works as it should, and I even have an HDMI switcher hooked up to one of the outputs of this splitter (because the bedroom TV only has one HDMI input, I have to have the switcher to switch between computer and cable). So this splitter works with the signal travelling through the splitter, a switcher, and three separate HDMI cables. No complaints!
customer_reviews.author: ritchie

customer_reviews.title: HDCP Fail for iMac to Samsung
customer_reviews.text: This doesn't work to "strip" HDCP from my iMac to my Samsung TV. All I want to do is watch an HDX movie I bought through VUDU. I'm not interested in watching movies on my iMac, so I connect HDMI to HDMI to watch through my Samsung. Thanks to HDCP, I am only allowed to watch in SD. This makes no sense. I bought the HDX, it shouldn't matter what display I use. In any case, this splitter doesn't solve the issue.
customer_reviews.author: JacobOKC

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended
customer_reviews.text: Nice inexpensive converter. I needed this to hook up my Slingbox and my TV without getting HDCP (High-bandwidth Digital Content Protection) errors and it works perfectly for that. It doesn't get 5 stars because it would be better to have a USB power input instead of a proprietary power supply that produces the same voltage. I'm not sure why manufacturers continue to use their own power supplies then using a micro-USB would be far more customer friendly and make travel far easier.
customer_reviews.author: charles

customer_reviews.title: Happy Dance!
customer_reviews.text: At first, it didn’t work, I tried it again in a few days before returning it. Glad I did, because it’s been great since! I bought it to work with a very, very old 30” Apple Cinema Display and my old AppleTV, I used an adapter which converted from VGA to HDMI. Of course, that was just the video, I still needed more for the audio.
customer_reviews.author: Little Navajo

customer_reviews.title: Very happy until Roku makes another
customer_reviews.text: I never had a problem with Roku and my Sanyo u til Roku did an update one day. The I hade to change the ratio to get the picture. Another update and I had an issue again. Purchased this based on the reviews. I no longer have to change multiple setting to get my Roku and Sanyo plasma tv to work together. I didn’t want to buy a new tv because of the changes they have made. It was frustrating. Now just takes a few seconds longer for the box to connect. Very happy until Roku makes another change
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Worked to eliminate the HDCP error
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this because my projector started to display the dreaded HDCP error and I can't easily replace the HDMI cord (read somewhere that I needed to). I hooked this up and it worked perfectly (November 2019). Now, when I try to run from my 4k Xbox One S to a 4k TV, it doesn't work. Simply changed the TV from UHD and it works again.
customer_reviews.author: Michael G. Mcclain

customer_reviews.title: Didn't fix problem
customer_reviews.text: The most glaring issue was that the instructions do not explain what the item is supposed to do, so it didn't work. It also didn't explain that I needed a third HDMI cord in order to hook it up. I knew I was taking a chance with this item and wasn't sure it would do what I wnated it to do, but would have sent it back if the instructions and results had been there.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: Recycling a very expensive boat anchor.
customer_reviews.text: We had a not so old (and very expensive at time of purchase) Sony Wega HD television that was rendered almost useless several years back when HDCP prevented us from watching nearly every HDMI source we had. It became the dedicated wii monitor in the basement until my son grew tired of playing it. We would have replaced the TV long ago if it weren't a four-man lift. The splitter allows us to finally use it again without significant degradation to the signal.
customer_reviews.author: telefunkin74

customer_reviews.title: Bought this for HDCP scrubbing for PlayStation 3 video capture.
customer_reviews.text: This product feels solid for its price. I bought it to scrub the built in HDCP (high-bandwidth digital copyright protection) from the output signal on my PlayStation 3, as I am a hobbyist video game reviewer. This was advertised as being able to scrub the signal and that's exactly what it does. The dual output makes it easy to run one signal to the TV while the other goes to an HDMI capture card. The only annoyance is the necessity of an outlet power supply.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick H. Ghee

customer_reviews.title: Fixes HDCP error for older tvs
customer_reviews.text: Took a roll on the dice, since there are quite a few reviews that this product no longer fixes HDCP errors. I can confirm that this still works (on a 13 year-old TV!) and fixes the black screen HDCP error as of late August 2019. Not sure why a seemingly not backward compatible standard could be enforced like that. But this is what you need to fix it.
customer_reviews.author: RealDave

customer_reviews.title: Great for recording lectures!
customer_reviews.text: I use this to record screencasts of lectures and it solved two issues that I had. First I wanted to split the signal from the presenters laptop and send one to the projector and one two a recording device. I use an Atmos Ninja to record video via the HDMI input and audio via a 3.5mm connection run from the podium microphone. The second issue was to work around issues regarding HDCP some laptops (like Apple) for HDCP on all the time even if you are just showing a PowerPoint and it won't let you record a screencast. This box fixes that problem and allows me to record directly via the Ninja
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Metal case possibly a negative
customer_reviews.text: Received this unit and was surprised on how small it was. Seemed very well constructed in a full metal case. Hooked it up and it worked fine for about 10 minutes. Then it started dropping the audio and then the video. Tried another HDMI cable with no change. The other problem I see with this unit is that it runs very hot. After about 15 minutes it was extremely warm to the touch bordering on getting hot. The worst thing for electronics is heat. Not sure this product would last long. Sadly dis-appointed with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Art R. Walicki

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY FOR HDCP STRIPPING
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in hopes it could help with the annoying "blinking" that occurs when we try to use my son's game console on our TV by stripping the HDCP signal. The version of this product that we received is now HDCP compliant and actually made the problem considerably worse. I will be returning this splitter.
customer_reviews.author: Lemonfresh

customer_reviews.title: Amazon Fire Stick 2 fix!
customer_reviews.text: I have an older 1080P connected to DirecTV. DirecTV had recently updated their HDCP nightmare/software which said my tv was non compliant and that I needed to revert to some outdated cables. Adding a Fire Stick 2 I received at Christmas made things worse. I read about the View HD and thought I would give it try. I connect it to the Fire Stick 2 per instructions and my errors are gone! I Very satisfied with this good product.
customer_reviews.author: papasurf

customer_reviews.title: Powered HDMI Mini Splitter for 1080P
customer_reviews.text: 1. Price was attractive and delivery. 2. Encountered overheating alerts using Roku 4 so I suspended I purchased this device in order to make an older "dumb" TV and signals interact with streaming content using a Roku 4 device. Initially everything worked however after sustained use I received overheating alerts from the Roku. Not sure what the cause of the temperature issue was, however replaced the Roku 4 with an Apple TV device. No need for the splitter as Apple TV is compatible with my "dumb" TV.
customer_reviews.author: George O'Neil

customer_reviews.title: It fixed my HDCP Unauthorized problem..for a while
customer_reviews.text: I have a newer (purchase a few months ago) Samsung Smart TV and a Roku Premiere Plus. They played nicely all this time, then suddenly this purple screen HDCP Unauthorized problem came up and I couldn't watch Youtube at all. This little unit fixed the problem!! **Update March 2019** this unit couldn't handle the new HDCP 2.2 standard, and we started getting the errors again. Scrapped it, bought a new and better Roku, which solved the problem. Still, it served us well for quite a while, so no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Pookie's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT strip HDCP
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to allow my Hauppauge PVR 2 to record my Xbox One. It does not strip HDCP at all. I still get a "copy protection"error with no video input. Tried it with other sources with the same failure. The unit works properly when splitting to my TV. Processing a return.
customer_reviews.author: Hello

customer_reviews.title: it works!
customer_reviews.text: Tried a number of things to get ride of annoying HDCP 2.0 error from Sling AirPlayer to Onkyo receiver, then to BenQ projector, but no luck. This small splitter really did the trick. I think it just removes HDCP signal. Now all devices are happy, with 1080p picture on screen and sounds into speakers. Very glad that I can watch Sling TV on projector now along with other inputs, thanks ViewHD!
customer_reviews.author: J. Li

customer_reviews.title: Yay for the HDCP stripper!! Ooh, cough, I meant splitter!! :)
customer_reviews.text: I bought this box with the specific purpose of stripping HDCP. My TV was hit by lightning and all of my HDMI ports were made HDCP incompatible although they still worked for everything else. For a specific example, my new Xbox One would play games (because there is no need for HDCP), but as soon as I inserted a blu-ray or dvd, bang! HDCP error... sad day... :( But as soon as I plugged in this little tiny beauty (Xbox One -> viewHD splitter -> TV), blu-rays now work!! Hooray!! Cue the streamers and confetti!! If this sounds similar to your need, than don't be afraid to buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Carl Kincaid

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected.  Fixed the HDCP bug.
customer_reviews.text: I have a new Samsung TV, new Amazon HDMI cables, and a 2015 Roku 3. I also pay for Neflix, Hulu, and Amazon Prime streaming services. One day, I got the dreaded HDCP Error. I must say the creators of this HDCP have no clue what they are doing. It stops no bad guys, but it gets in the way of paying consumers like me. So here I go using this to get around it. It works as expected. Very small too. Side note: I recommend that when you hook up this devlce, go ahead and do a factory reset on your Roku 3 just to clear out any caching stuff.
customer_reviews.author: James A

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfectly For Your Digital Capture Needs
customer_reviews.text: This product works as advertised. Splits my HD signal from my FireStick and/or BluRay player and sends it to my Elgato HD60S with no interference and no signal loss. Just make sure you don't swap out the power supply without checking the voltage - this unit EASILY fries quickly if you put too much power into it. HIGHLY recommended for capturing.
customer_reviews.author: Sam L.

customer_reviews.title: 2020 Update: Does Remove HDCP
customer_reviews.text: Was able to connect my PS3 to both my Elgato and my Magewell capture cards, no issue. Also works as a wonderful lagless splitter. Money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: RetroGamerGuy

customer_reviews.title: Signal Splitter Solved Spectrum Problem
customer_reviews.text: I installed this inline from my new Spectrum cable box into Onkyo receiver and then out to my 80 inch Sharp TV. It totally came through with a super nice picture and audio. Spectrum is only 1080, so no problems. If I upgrade to a 4k TV, Spectrum will still only be 1080. I'll stream 4k content from my Fire Cube.
customer_reviews.author: Targeting123

customer_reviews.title: Cured HDCP Problems
customer_reviews.text: This splitter cured a very mysterious HDMI/HDCP problem I was having between my Hitachi Ultravision TV, and Denon AV receiver and/or an Apple TV. The Apple TV was giving a message "This content requires HDCP for playback", and the Denon would just go to a black screen after a few seconds. I was never trying to copy anything or break copy protection. I just wanted to watch my shows. I ended up buying this splitter and putting it in-line between the AV receiver and the TV. Problem solved. I'm only using one output of the splitter in this setup. It works fine. May the purveyors of DRM be forever afflicted with technical issues with all their personal gadgets.
customer_reviews.author: J. M. Cox

customer_reviews.title: Defeats HDCP
customer_reviews.text: I bought this HDMI splitter for the purpose of defeating the HDCP (high-bandwidth digital content protection) of the Playstation 3. With this splitter, I can easily stream gameplay from my PS3 to Twitch. If you're interested in this product for the same reason I was, then let me describe my setup for you. I am using an Elgato HD60 Pro capture card, and I'm using OBS to stream to Twitch. The HDMI out of my PS3 is connected to the input of this splitter. One of the splitter's outputs goes to the HD60 Pro, and the other goes directly to my monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just one more thing for streaming
customer_reviews.text: I have this with my HDMI cord and now i need a capture card to go with my streaming plus i seen this on Youtube video and they mention this a lot for mostly Streaming or recording for videos, i got both for good price and now i just need a capture card
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Putnal

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT BYPASS HDCP COMPLIANCE
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to bypass HDCP Compliance for Netflix so that I can watch the services I pay for on my dual screen laptop. It did not work. I am returning. The product splits HDMI (so 5/5) for that. But does not bypass HDCP Compliance.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous Shopper

customer_reviews.title: It did not remove HDCP
customer_reviews.text: Typical of these products, it appears to be a hit and miss exercise. Some people claim it removed HDCP, I was not that lucky. I can not say that I wasted my money because it splits the signal and one day I may need it, but that was not the intent of the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT!
customer_reviews.text: AMAZING LITTLE ITEM. IT IS GREAT. I USE IT WITH THE HDMI CLONER BOX THAT I ALSO BOUGHT ON AMAZON. THIS SPLITTER WORKS GREAT. IT DEFEATS THE COPY RIGHT PROTECTION FROM VERIZON'S CABLE BOX SO NOW I CAN RECORD ANYTHING FROM MY TV.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Stop HDCP content blocked.
customer_reviews.text: Hdcp content blocked. I have a 10 yr old plasma that stopped working with my set top box.. the screen kept saying the above. after reading and reading I was looking at can't article and it recommended this and it works!!!! I thought I was going to have to throw out this beautiful plasma screen, but this worked 100 percent.
customer_reviews.author: frank german

customer_reviews.title: ViewHD 2 Port 1x2 Powered HDMI Mini Splitter
customer_reviews.text: I had problems with HDCP preventing me viewing paid for HD content on my computer, even though I am using an HDCP compliant monitor, cable and video card. So I connected this HDMI splitter between the computer and screen, using 2 AmazonBasics HDMI cables, and I can again watch the HD movies I have paid for, all in glorious HD! What the hell are they doing with HDCP...? All it does is make it difficult for honest people who paid good money for HD content unable to watch the movies and TV shows they have paid for. HDCP does nothing to stop dishonest people copying content. I see a class action lawsuit in the future. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Jono

customer_reviews.title: If you own an older TV, you want this.
customer_reviews.text: Despite other reviews and even the product description, as of this date this box will allow you to use your old HDMI-enabled TV with modern streaming devices. Much cheaper than buying a new flatscreen!
customer_reviews.author: Virgil

customer_reviews.title: This does NOT solve HDCP error between XBOX 360 and ...
customer_reviews.text: This does NOT solve HDCP error between XBOX 360 and new Samsung 4K tv. I bought this as it was touted as "the solution" on several blogs and tech sites but it does not deliver as stated. New 4k cables, updated software all around. No dice.
customer_reviews.author: J. West

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly with no signal loss.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and works perfectly with my other video gear.
customer_reviews.author: David N.

customer_reviews.title: HDCP stripping works for older hdmi devices!
customer_reviews.text: I was shopping for a long time looking for a splitter that can strip out HDCP for my PS3 when used with my El Gato game capture HD. I was a bit fearful reading some of the comments here, but as of 2-20-19, it does work great! No more recording component video which makes a super clear video image! Also, there is content I'd like to record from my 2nd generation Chromecast and it works! So I believe if your device is hdmi output 1.3 then this is what you want.
customer_reviews.author: Starlord Gamer

customer_reviews.title: Inserted between DirecTV Genie and Hauppauge HD-PVR 2.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I wasn't planning on using both outputs, but I noticed a substantial delay between sending commands to the Genie and observing the results in WinTV. This is due to the way WinTV buffers the video. By connecting a second monitor to the splitter, I can watch the Genie output with almost no delay, making navigation of the Genie menus much more agreeable. If you have DirecTV and go with a Hauppauge HD-PVR 2, consider the mini-splitter a "must have".
customer_reviews.author: Slim

customer_reviews.title: Strips HDCP on PS3 still!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I could stream my PS3 on twitch and luckily this splitter still strips the HDCP on the PS3 as of 5/4/2019. I simply plugged the power in then connected all my HDMI cables in and powered on my PS3. I am using an Elgato HD60 Pro internal card in my PC. Worked the first time without changing any settings I had. Picked up video and audio very well. Would recommend every time to anyone wanting to strip the HDCP on their PS3.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: If you want to stream vita tv content you need this.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I'm recording playstation vita tv content. This unit will remove the copy protection so that you can record HDMI output via an Elgato HDMI recording device. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: Kooshy Monster

customer_reviews.title: If does what it's supposed to do...
customer_reviews.text: This HDMI splitter does exactly what was needed. Takes one video signal and provides to two projectors. Easy to install and no degradation in quality of signal that I could notice. Only feeding 1080p projector, so not sure about 4k video signals. I am very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: F. D. Krebs

customer_reviews.title: I got the Amazon Fire TV and was SOOOO disappointed when I plugged it into my slightly older model ...
customer_reviews.text: I got the Amazon Fire TV and was SOOOO disappointed when I plugged it into my slightly older model flat screen and it didn't work. I nearly returned the Fire TV. I started doing some research and found out that before my TV was slightly older, it was unable to "interpret" the current HDMI signal - that's my way of simplifying what I read :) I saw a couple posts that suggested getting a splitter/converter so I shopped around and came across this one. I got it, plugged my Fire TV into IT, then another HDMI cable for IT to my TV and crossed my fingers.... Works perfectly!!
customer_reviews.author: J. Crosbie

customer_reviews.title: Functionality is poor and device unusable
customer_reviews.text: This thing sucks. It is a cheap piece that would not show the picture through both ports. Only one hdmi signal would come through and when I switched it over it would not display the second. I switched the hdmi cables to make sure the cable was not faulty but it yielded the same results. Only when one cable was plugged in would either port work but not with two plugged in simultaneously. This still sits in a drawer unused. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Al'Thor Gaming

customer_reviews.title: Fixes HDCP problems
customer_reviews.text: HDCP, like most protection mechanisms, is great on paper but breaks too many legitimate use cases that it should have been torn up and never implemented. In my case this was a Slingbox. I used this to allow my Slingbox to work alongside a TV when the TV is using the HDMI feed. Some boxes like DirecTV get the HDCP confused under this setup meaning that Slingbox only works when TV is on, which defeats the purpose of using a Slingbox. This box fixes that by providing a constant HDCP signal to the box.
customer_reviews.author: SierraQ

customer_reviews.title: Cheap solution to solve what was major headache
customer_reviews.text: Installed March 2020 and was able to display cable box signal on LED wall with DVI input. Did find the audio levels to be extremely low on HDMI outputs so had to use HDMI audio deembedder to convert to analog and get better levels that were more on par with other sources, but fact video passed was a success story. Very happy with results
customer_reviews.author: Boston626

customer_reviews.title: Solved my capture card problem
customer_reviews.text: It does exactly what I needed it to do. August 2016 and it solved my suspected HDCP problem. My son has been using a Rocketfish splitter between his Elgato and Xbox one to make YouTube gaming videos. He used Netflix one time and then nothing could get the capture card to work. Internet search said it might be an HDCP issue. I traded out the Rocketfish for this little guy and problem solved. We've been using it for about 5 minutes so I can't comment on durability but so far I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa C

customer_reviews.title: Worked great, but died in 7 months
customer_reviews.text: Gave it three stars only because it died after 7 months. Worked perfectly until it demise. It appears the power controlling IC has failed. To be fair, it was on 24/7, but i still think a slid state device should last longer than that. Luckily, Amazon has one in in damaged packaging that I picked up for $18. I bought it to strip HDCP (Yes - you all, it does indeed allow you to view HDMI without the HDCP interference) from my TIVO signal because my TV is 12 years old and doesn't support it. I would have preferred the same function with multiple inputs instead of outputs (my old TV only has a single HDMI port)
customer_reviews.author: Stuart and Lisa Smith

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical after reading some of the bad reviews but I used it and it works as advertised. I couldn't find fault. Only time will tell about the durability.
customer_reviews.author: PhotovideogoTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: HDCP stripper so you can use your older TV
customer_reviews.text: HDCP is a copy protection scheme to keep you from recording copy protected content. The problem is many of us have older HDMI devices before the copy protections started and if both don't have HDCP you just get an error message. This is the solution I use to connect my DIrecTV to the Slingbox 500. Yes I might be breaking some arbitrary law, but I am paying $134 for the service and I am going to watch it wherever I am. I shouldn't be forced to buy new equipment because the media industry says so.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: fixed Amazon's streaming issue
customer_reviews.text: solved my amazon video streaming issue. amazon videos I purchase were not view-able via my projector because my HDMI cable was lacking some validation feature. seriously amazon video needs to do something about this. this device solved the problem. i just put this in line between two HDMI cables and magically the false piracy issue (created by amazon) with my HDMI cable (even though i paid for and owned the amazon video content) went away.
customer_reviews.author: Bill-Borg

customer_reviews.title: Can't view video from my PS4 on my HD LED,LCD or Plasma screen.
customer_reviews.text: So I have a 55 inch Smart TV from Visio that failed to read my PS3 and Ps4 due to HDCP. My Xbox one worked and my Ps4 would work if I ported it through, so I bought this and now I can use my TV yay! HDCP is High Definition Copyright Protection. Essentially blocking you from recording digital sources. These devices are not designed to "strip HDCP" but it does work for that purpose as a pass-through. If you have an X-Box One and a PS3 or Ps4, tun the HDMI out from the PS to the HDMI in on the Xbox One and say"X-box watch TV" presto! there is the start up menu for your PS3 or 4.
customer_reviews.author: i buyalot

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT filter out HDCP on Tunes TV shows and movies
customer_reviews.text: We bought this because there were a lot of comments and blogs suggesting that it could be used to filter out HDCP so you can play iTunes TV shows and movies directly from an iPhone or iPad over TVs and projectors that are not HDCP compliant. Contrary to those comments, it does NOT do this. This will not allow you to play iTunes TV shows and movies on on non-HDCP TVs and projectors without the use of an Apple TV.
customer_reviews.author: Weezy Girl

customer_reviews.title: Product works for HDCP problems.  Love it
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptical because of some previous reviews, but I got exactly what I wanted. I was looking for a product that would allow me to be able to have my xbox run through my hauppauge capture system while watching tv, which meant the HDCP needed to be transferred around my hauppauge system. This product works flawlessly. No noticeable lag or degradation in quality. If you are blocked by the HDCP this product will take care of that problem. I also love the split part because one goes directly into my tv and the other goes into my hauppauge which means I don't have to have my hauppauge on when I am not recording.
customer_reviews.author: DaCreature

customer_reviews.title: Strips off HDCP call eliminating hdcp 2.0 error!
customer_reviews.text: The splitter removed the hdcp 2.0 call from Roku Ultimate (hulu) to my 2013 Samsung which only supports hdcp 1.4. I no longer have hdcp 2.0 errors when streaming live tv using hulu. My 65 inch Samsung was built in December 2013. This $18.50 splitter allows me to avoid spending $2,000 to upgrade my set!
customer_reviews.author: Fortunate

customer_reviews.title: Strips HDCP, I can now watch Blu Rays on my laptop.
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as described. AC power must be plugged in at all times to work and it indeed strips the HDCP. I tested it on my PS4 Pro with the HDCP turned on within the system settings. I connected two HDMI cables to transmit a signal to my Elgato HD60S which I had OBS opened on my laptop and sure enough I was able to watch a blu ray on my laptop. There’s zero loss in quality. Very satisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great device for an old TV that is not HDCP compliant
customer_reviews.text: This device allowed an Amazon Fire TV Stick to work on an ancient LCD TV circa 2004 (not HDCP compliant). Definitely worth the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: RM

customer_reviews.title: Lets me edit home video.
customer_reviews.text: Yep. Great. HDCP no problem. I like to put my old VCR home videos onto the hard drive of my Magnavox DVR so I can edit. The Magnavox DVR causes troubles because it outputs HDCP even when I am working with my own home video source material. With this View HD splitter, HDCP is not a probelem and I can feed my edited home videos out my Magnavox HDMI, through this splitter, and into my Aver EZRecorder130 to get mp4 x264 video files that should be playable for years to come. Problem solved.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: It DOES strip HDCP as advetised. One of the easiest devices ever purchased, installed and used. So good, I've got another one on the way.
customer_reviews.author: O. McClung

customer_reviews.title: It's great for visual feedback for participants
customer_reviews.text: HDCP is starting to flake out on my 42" Toshiba from 2009. While Netflix and hulu had no issues, HBO Go started to throw errors about HDCP. This happened only on my Toshiba set. The Magnavox and Sharp sets could not reproduce the issue. This device is able to deal with it. Update. I am using this now to split the mini hdmi out of a Canon EOS 70d for a photo booth. It's great for visual feedback for participants.
customer_reviews.author: W. Savacool

customer_reviews.title: It does work with older model TV to allow streaming service.
customer_reviews.text: I have an older model TV that doesn't have the special permission to use with streaming services. So I bought this port trying to save money on buying a new TV. It does work! Yes!
customer_reviews.author: MiMisma

customer_reviews.title: Great in removing HDMI port HDCP errors for cable box.
customer_reviews.text: Was told by my cable company I needed to buy a new TV to use HDMI input for my older TV. Was getting a HDCP error and the cable box disabled the output HDMI port. Since the splitter sends a compliance response to the cable box and does not query its outputs, the TV now works with HDMI. Seems to work well but it is the first day of use.
customer_reviews.author: BenFlorida

product_meta.title: ViewHD 2 Port 1x2 Powered HDMI 1 in 2 Out Mini Splitter for 1080P & 3D | Model: VHD-1X2MN3D
product_meta.description: Length:v1.3 | 1080P| Color:1x2Attention This VHD-1X2MN3D model is an HDMI v1.3 1080P generation product it is not forward compatible to HDMI v1.4/2.0 4K generations of products when both the HDMI source and the display are 4K models, there will be no video because it does not perform 4K handshake protocol. It will work when at least one of them (the HDMI signal source or the display) is an HDMI v1.3 or earlier generation product. ViewHD 1x2 HDMI compact / mini splitter distributes 1 HDMI source signal to 2 HDMI displays simultaneously up to 1080P. It comes with 100V-240V AC to DC 5V1A power adapter and user manual. Service by J&R Galaxies 30 day no restocking fee return policy and U9 / ViewHD one year replacement warranty.
feature_bullets: The model "VHD-1X2MN3D"may come under two labels: U9 or ViewHD; HDMI 1.3 supports 480i/576i/480p/576p/720p/1080i/1080p + 3D; for 3D application, both of the connected displays must support 3D for 3D to work.
This model is for 1080p or lower video. Please check our latest "U9-Pluto" model instead, the U9-Pluto model can completely replace this model and is compatible to HDMI v2.0 source and displays
HDMI 1x2 Splitter provides the same video and audio signals identical to HDMI input signal at both outputs at the same time.
Edid duration 4 seconds. This model doesn't support CEC, CEC is not a suitable feature for HDMI splitter, it is good for HDMI switch.
Max Cable extension 10 meters by 28Awg HDMI cable 15 meters by 26Awg HDMI cable
For HDMI 2.0 4k@60 application, check our latest HDMI 2.0 Models: UHD1X2S and UHD1X2SA
Please feel free to contact us if there is any questions, please always contact us when encounter any application problem
ViewHD / U9 one year replacement warranty
Durable and reliable full metal jacket construction; package includes: universal 100V - 240V AC to DC 5V1A Universal power adapter with US plug, user manual and 1x2 DHMI splitter
